intro: Hybridella anthemidifolia, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often appearing in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, alpine climates. Hybridella anthemidifolia is often found in meadows and slopes at high elevations, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
